Is the Coca-Cola Scholarship yearly?

The coca-cola scholar’s Foundation or CCSF is a non-profit organization that works on behalf and in the way of the coca-cola system (including the coca-cola company, the world’s biggest manufacturer of non-alcoholic beverages, and its numerous subsidiaries) to offer scholarships to some 1,400 students yearly.

Eligibility Requirements

According to the most current necessities, to be qualified to apply for the Coca-Cola Scholarship, you have to:

  • Applicant must be a current high school (or home-schooled) student attending a school in the US
  • Graduate and accept a high school diploma in a similar academic year as the scholarship application time limit
  • Be a U.S. citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident, Refugee, Asylee, Cuban-Haitian Entrant, or compassionate Parolee
  • be determined to chase a degree at an accredited U. S. post-secondary institution

You must also not be

The child or grandchild of an employee, officer, or owner of the Coca-Cola bottling companies, The Coca-Cola Company, Company divisions, or subsidiaries.

Coca-Cola Scholarship Timeline:

August: the coca-cola scholarship request opens

October: application stop at the end of the month

Mayember: 2,000 semi-finalists are preferred to proceed

December: semifinalist submit additional scholarship application materials

January: semi-finalists are narrowed down to 250 applications

February: remaining semi-finalists participate in regional interviews

March: 150 Coca-Cola Scholarship winners are announced

Late March /Early April: Scholarship winners are invited to attend scholar weekend in Atlanta.

What types of questions should you expect|Coca-Cola Scholarship

Actually, since Coca-Cola scholars for leadership and service, it’s a good suggestion to be ready to answer interview questions like;

  • Tell me about a personal success that makes you proud
  • Who are your role models?
  • What do you plan to study at the university and why?
  • What are your career goals?
  • Why do you think you can deserve this scholarship?

When can I start applying for scholarships?

Every scholarship has different rules and also deadline varies, Federal student aid recommends that students start researching for scholarships the summer after their junior year of high year, and you can even start before that some may required submissions of a year prior to start college.

What happens if your financial aid is more than your tuition?

When your school gives you financial aid, sometimes money is leftover your aid is applied to your tuition fees, and other school charges, this remaining amount is called credit balance.
